net.java.dev.designgridlayout
Interface ISubGridStarter

All Known Subinterfaces:
IGridRow, IRowCreator, ISpannableGridRow
public interface ISubGridStarter

This interface is used to start a new canonical grid row (when called from DesignGridLayout.row()), or to start a new canonical sub-grid in the current grid row (when called from IGridRow).

Using one of the grid() methods of this interface is mandatory before adding any further component to the current row.

Every time grid() is called for the current row, a new sub-grid is started, with its own specific label column, and additional gap from the previous sub-grid.

Author:
Jean-Francois Poilpret

Method Summary

Method Detail

grid

ISpannableGridRow grid(JLabel label)
Starts a new sub-grid in the row, starting with a label.

Labels have a special treatment: they are not a part of the canonical grid but use a fixed-width on the left of the canonical grid. Labels are automatically right-aligned.

The new sub-grid initiated by this call will span all space on its right unless another call to a grid() method occurs in the same row.

That sub-grid also allows adding span components, i.e. components that have been added to a row above this row.

Parameters:
label - the label to add to this row
Returns:
this row (to allow chaining other methods for the current row)
See Also:
ISpannableGridRow.spanRow()

grid

IGridRow grid(JLabel label,
              int gridspan)
Starts a new sub-grid in the row, starting with a label.

Labels have a special treatment: they are not a part of the canonical grid but use a fixed-width on the left of the canonical grid. Labels are automatically right-aligned.

The new sub-grid initiated by this call will span a certain number of sub-grids on its right, as determined by gridspan.

Parameters:
label - the label to add to this row
gridspan - the number of sub-grids this new sub-grid should span; if <= 0, then the behavior is the same as grid(JLabel).
Returns:
this row (to allow chaining other methods for the current row)

grid

ISpannableGridRow grid()
Starts a new sub-grid in the row, starting with an empty label.

Labels (empty or not) have a special treatment: they are not a part of the canonical grid but use a fixed-width on the left of the canonical grid. Labels are automatically right-aligned.

The new sub-grid initiated by this call will span all space on its right unless another call to a grid() method occurs in the same row.

That sub-grid also allows adding span components, i.e. components that have been added to a row above this row.

Returns:
this row (to allow chaining other methods for the current row)
See Also:
ISpannableGridRow.spanRow()

grid

IGridRow grid(int gridspan)
Starts a new sub-grid in the row, starting with an empty label.

Labels (empty or not) have a special treatment: they are not a part of the canonical grid but use a fixed-width on the left of the canonical grid. Labels are automatically right-aligned.

The new sub-grid initiated by this call will span a certain number of sub-grids on its right, as determined by gridspan.

Parameters:
gridspan - the number of sub-grids this new sub-grid should span; if <= 0, then the behavior is the same as grid().
Returns:
this row (to allow chaining other methods for the current row)
